result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua D Estes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua D Estes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua D Estes was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

Same conditions as probation.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  Must not engage in any verbal or physical contact toward Brooke E or his children.
03/10/2016 CORRECTED CONDITION FROM MUST NOT POSSESS OR CONSUME CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES OR DRUG PARAPHERNALIA TO MUST NOT POSSESS OR CONSUME CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES UNLESS PRESCRIBED BY A LICENSED PYSICIAN, OR DRUG PARAPHERNALIA".
Must complete 26-week or comparable domestic violence programming.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

timeConds.notes:
Must complete 50 hours each year while on probation unless he wants to complete it sooner.
6/20/2019 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS INSTEAD OF 100 HOURS COMMUNITY SERVICE, MUST COMPLETE 150 HOURS OF TREATMENT. TREATMENT MAY BE INPATIENT OR OUTPATIENT (AA/NA/CHURCH ETC). ANY HOURS PREVIOUSLY COMPLETED DURING CURRENT PROBATION SENTENCE WILL APPLY TOWARD HOURS OF TREATMENT ORDERED. TREATMENT MUST BE COMPLETED BY CONCLUSION OF THIS SENTENCE.
